trans-unit.target: Max ingress<html></html>3<html></html> per storage account (European and Asian Regions)

trans-unit.target: Max egress<html></html>3<html></html> per storage account (European and Asian Regions)

trans-unit.target: 10 Gbps if GRS/ZRS<html></html>4<html></html> enabled, 15 Gbps for LRS

trans-unit.source: <html></html>1<html></html>If you require more than 100 storage accounts, contact <link><linkText>Azure Support</linkText><title></title></link> for assistance.
trans-unit.target: <html></html>1<html></html>If you require more than 100 storage accounts, contact <link><linkText>Azure Support</linkText><title></title></link> for assistance.

trans-unit.source: <html></html>2<html></html>The total request rate limit for a storage account is 20,000 IOPS.
trans-unit.target: <html></html>2<html></html>The total request rate limit for a storage account is 20,000 IOPS.

trans-unit.source: If a virtual machine utilizes the maximum IOPS per disk, then to avoid possible throttling, ensure that the total IOPS across all of the virtual machines' VHDs does not exceed the storage account limit (20,000 IOPS).
trans-unit.target: If a virtual machine utilizes the maximum IOPS per disk, then to avoid possible throttling, ensure that the total IOPS across all of the virtual machines' VHDs does not exceed the storage account limit (20,000 IOPS).

trans-unit.source: You can roughly calculate the number of highly utilized disks supported by a single storage account based on the transaction limit.
trans-unit.target: You can roughly calculate the number of highly utilized disks supported by a single storage account based on the transaction limit.

trans-unit.source: For example, for a Basic Tier VM, the maximum number of highly utilized disks is about 66 (20,000/300 IOPS per disk), and for a Standard Tier VM, it is about 40 (20,000/500 IOPS per disk).
trans-unit.target: For example, for a Basic Tier VM, the maximum number of highly utilized disks is about 66 (20,000/300 IOPS per disk), and for a Standard Tier VM, it is about 40 (20,000/500 IOPS per disk).

trans-unit.source: However, note that the storage account can support a larger number of disks if they are not all highly utilized at the same time.
trans-unit.target: However, note that the storage account can support a larger number of disks if they are not all highly utilized at the same time.

trans-unit.source: 3Ingress refers to all data (requests) being sent to a storage account.
trans-unit.target: 3Ingress refers to all data (requests) being sent to a storage account.

trans-unit.source: Egress refers to all data (responses) being received from a storage account.
trans-unit.target: Egress refers to all data (responses) being received from a storage account.

trans-unit.source: <html></html>4<html></html>GRS refers to geo-redundant storage.
trans-unit.target: <html></html>4<html></html>GRS refers to geo-redundant storage.

trans-unit.source: ZRS refers to zone-redundant storage, and is available only for block blobs.
trans-unit.target: ZRS refers to zone-redundant storage, and is available only for block blobs.

trans-unit.source: LRS refers to locally redundant storage.
trans-unit.target: LRS refers to locally redundant storage.
